title: Call Records:  30314 Benecia Ave, Laguna Niguel

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Call Records:  30314 Benecia Ave, Laguna Niguel
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records regarding calls for service, including CAD call records, at 30314 Benicia Ave, Laguna Niguel, CA between October 1, 2024, and December 8, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

William Frederick

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] California Public Records Act Request: Call Records: 30314 Benecia Ave, Laguna Niguel
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon,

The Orange County Sheriff’s Department searched its records and have no records responsive to your request.

Thank you,

Brenda Martin | CPRA Supervisor
Records Division | Orange County Sheriff’s Department
Tel: (714) 834-6449 | Email: bmartin@ocsheriff.gov<mailto:bmartin@ocsheriff.gov>

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: MC Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

All calls for service and incident reports at the following address between 12/7/2024 and 12/9/2024 [inclusive]:

 407 East Plank Road

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Daniel Truelaw

communications.subject: No Reply Re: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: MC Request
communications.communication:
This email account is not monitored 24/7.  If you have an emergency, please call 911.  If you wish to file a Police Report, or ask a Police related question, please contact the Desk Officer.  The Desk Officer can be reached at 814-949-2489 option 1, or you can visit the Police Station in person 24/7. 

Thank you 
PERSONAL & CONFIDENTIAL. The E-Mail message (Including any attachments) from this sender is for the sole use of the intended recipient(s) and may contain confidential and privileged information. If the reader of this message is not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any dissemination, distribution, unauthorized review, use or disclosure of this E-Mail is prohibited.  If you have received this communication in error, please immediately notify us, by contacting ITMGR@AltoonaPA.gov, returning the original message to the sender and deleting any copies from your system.  Thank you

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Bruce Plesser, Case #GP22-13114
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Crash report date: 8/3/2022
All documents from Pinellas County and Fl Highway Patrol
any investigatory notes taken on the date of the alleged accident
-any alcohol or drug tests administered to the driver on that day
-any photos or interviews taken at the scene of the accident, including but not limited to the street, the car, the scene of impact, injuries to both parties, and witness statements of movements of both parties leading up to event
-interviews related to statements given The Gabber
-witness statements explaining exactly what happened, how this occurred, why so much force was applied in a low speed area, why 911 wasn’t called initially, how long it took for an ambulance to arrive, a step by step recreation of what occurred when help finally arrived, and then a detailed description of the accident and investigation, including the speed of impact, the damage to the car, the driver’s state of mind, conditions of the road, and the Highway Patrol’s investigation (as my father died)
-any communications between police and driver regarding investigation
-any discussions between police and Press
-any discussions between police and hospital, including but not limited to my fathers phone, his history of alcoholism, and disposal of his body
-any communications regarding or about my father's stolen phone (used to get my # as he lay dying) and then, despite my saying to the hospital the phone had to be locked up, was then stolen off his cold dead body
-any communications about the decision to cremate without autopsy against my wishes
-any internal communications with other FL agencies or with any member of my former defense
-any emails or texts or internal documents either within Pinellas County formally or informally 2 weeks prior to the event to present that discusses my father or this event directly or indirectly.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Sam

title: IRB documents related to the study published in JAMA, doi:10.1001/jama.2024.2424

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: IRB documents related to the study published in JAMA, doi:10.1001/jama.2024.2424
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents, memoranda, e-mails, and reports issued or received by the Institutional Review Board (IRB) related to the NIH Study: Pierpaoli. Neuroimaging Findings in US Government Personnel and Their Family Members Involved in Anomalous Health Incidents. JAMA. Published March 18, 2024. doi:10.1001/jama.2024.2424

Besides the doi address above, a web link to the study is https://jamanetwork.com/journals/jama/fullarticle/2816532 and the file of the published study is attached to this FOIA request.

Documents, memoranda, e-mails, and reports issued by or received by the IRB  related to the study should be collected from January 1, 2017 until December 9, 2024.

Request for Expedited Processing

I am filing this request in my role as a Board Member for Targeted Justice, Inc., a non-profit 501(c)(3) organization, and a news organization. Targeted Justice's status as a news organization that provides information of public interest to its members warrants the expedited processing of this Request on the grounds that there is a compelling need for these records because the information requested is urgently needed by an organization primarily engaged in disseminating information in order to inform the public about actual or alleged Federal Government activity. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E)(v)(II); see also 22 C.F.R. § 171.12(b)(2); 28 C.F.R. § n16.5(d)(1)(ii); 32 C.F.R. § 286.4(d)(3)(ii); 32 C.F.R. § 1900.34(c)(2). Targeted Justice currently has over 16,000 subscribers and over 130,000 thousand views a month in its Substack newsletter. Thus, pursuant to 47 CFR 0.466 it is a news media organization.

Targeted Justice also requests the expedited processing of this request on the grounds that the records and documents requested relate to a “breaking news story of general public interest”. Furthermore, they present a “matter of widespread and exceptional media interest in which there exist possible questions about the government’s integrity which affect public confidence”. Expedited processing is warranted when “the information is relevant to a subject of public urgency concerning an actual or alleged Federal government activity” See 22 C.F.R. § 171.12(b)(2)(i); 32 C.F.R. § 286.4(d)(3)(ii)(A); see also 28 C.F.R. § 16.5(d)(1)(iv); 32 C.F.R. § 1900.34(c)(2).

In light of the above, Targeted Justice requests that your agency adheres to the legal mandate contained in 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i); see 28 C.F.R. § 16.6(b), (c) and consequently produce within 20 days of receipt of this request the information sought.

Request for Fee Waiver

Targeted Justice hereby requests a fee waiver of search, review, and duplication fees on the grounds that disclosure of the requested records is “in the public interest because it is likely to significantly contribute to public understanding of the operations or activities of the government and is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester.” See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii); see also 22 C.F.R. § 171.17(a); 28 C.F.R. § 16.11(k); 32 C.F.R. § 286.28(d); 32 C.F.R. § 1900.13(b)(2).

Furthermore, a waiver of search and review fees is warranted inasmuch as Targeted Justice will report the results of this endeavor on the grounds that Targeted Justice qualifies as a “representative of the news media” and that the records are not sought for commercial use. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii))(7); 32 C.F.R. §§ 1900.02(h)(3), 1900.13(i)(2).

For any document you fail to produce, Targeted Justice requests that you provide a Vaughn Index and declaration setting forth reasonably detailed explanations for each withheld document as to why it falls within any statutory exemption. See Vaughn v. Rosen, 484 F.2d 820 (D.C. Cir. 1973). The Vaughn statement must specify details about each document's sender, recipients, date and time, and subject.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Len Ber MD
Global Medical Leader
Board Member
Targeted Justice, Inc., a non-profit 501(c)(3) organization

417 Cardinal Dr.
Bloomingdale, IL 60108

Ph: 630-450-7014
e-mail: lenber@protonmail.com
Website: www.TargetedJustice.com
